title: DeQuade
author: DeQuade
content: Hello. Question more to the forum administration. I've not been here for a long time and perhaps forgot how everything works here . Going to the "Watchlist" section, I saw that none of the topics that I subscribed to are on the list. When I going to the "Edit watchlist" section, everything are in place (can select and delete them). Topics in the "Watchlist" appear only when there are new messages in them, or this is a bug and topics should always be visible?

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: DeQuade on July 24, 2023, 04:54:22 PM Topics in the "Watchlist" appear only when there are new messages in them, or this is a bug and topics should always be visible?They only appear when there are new posts in them.It also usually only appears during a certain period of time, since the last post and when you visit the Watchlist.

comments.author: DeQuade
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on July 24, 2023, 06:22:07 PMThey only appear when there are new posts in them.It also usually only appears during a certain period of time, since the last post and when you visit the Watchlist.For some reason I suggested that the function should work as "Bookmarks" or "Favorites". Where all the topics are visible, but unread are highlighted with bold font (like topics in some forum subsection).

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: DeQuade on July 24, 2023, 07:50:22 PMFor some reason I suggested that the function should work as "Bookmarks" or "Favorites". Where all the topics are visible, but unread are highlighted with bold font (like topics in some forum subsection).This suggestion is even interesting. Although the current form works very well for anyone who frequents the forum on a daily or almost daily basis.Perhaps for those who have not come to the forum for a long time, and the topics that are under observation no longer have answers, they may no longer appear on the list.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Did you uncheck the option to automatically watch a topic after replying to them?When typing a reply, go to Additional Options and uncheck "watch this topic" so it doesn't get automatically added into your watchlist.

Topics in the "Watchlist" appear only when there are new messages in them, or this is a bug and topics should always be visible?From your account's watchlist page, you will see four options, the following twos like match with your question.Watch list postsThis will add all topics you've posted in to your watchlist.Watch list notificationsThis will add all topics that you're receiving notifications for to your watchlist.You can customize how you receive notifications in your profile pageTurn notification on when you post or reply to a topic.When sending notification of a reply to a topic, send the post in the email (but please don't reply to these emails.)Current topic notificationsFor topics and boards I've requested notification on, notify me of:Replies and moderationModeration only if I started the topicOnly repliesNothing at all

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: I, personally, have a different way of checking the forum topics which interest me. Instead of "Watchlist" I am using the button "Show new replies to your posts". As the name of the button says, when I click on it I see a list of topics where I posted before and where new posts were made by others. This way I am sure I am not missing anything from those threads. Some may call it old fashion, but I got used with getting updated in this way.In rest, I have a bunch of boards which I'm usually checking, although I may not make any post there. But I have this list of board in my head everyday so I'm checking them naturally, not by consulting a file and see which boards I checked already and which I have to still check. For example, I am going through Bitcoin Discussion, Romanian board, Meta, Beginners & Help, Reputation, Scam Accusation, Collectibles etc. So although I'm not always posting there there are my favorite boards and I'm always checking the activity on them.And, in rest, the button "Show new replies to your posts" helps me to see all the topics where I wrote before and which have new activity.
